an3.2:4.1: “A fool is characterized by their deeds; an astute person is characterized by their deeds. And wisdom becomes evident in the way that it manifests.
an3.2:4.2: A fool is known by three things.
an3.2:4.4: Bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.
an3.2:4.5: These are the three things by which a fool is known.
an3.2:5.1: An astute person is known by three things.
an3.2:5.3: Good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.
an3.2:5.4: These are the three things by which an astute person is known.
an3.2:6.1: So you should train like this:
an3.2:6.2: ‘We will reject the three things by which a fool is known, and we will undertake and implement the three things by which an astute person is known.’
